module.name: vRSLCM
module.description: vRealize/Aria Lifecycle Manager plug-in for Orchestrator

finder.description: A vRSLCM server connection in the inventory.

properties.property: Display Name of the vRSLCM Connection in Orchestrator.
Unique ID of the vRSLCM Connection in Orchestrator.
The Hostname of the vRSLCM Server.
The Required OAuth2.0 Client ID to use in authentication requests to VMware Identity Manager.
The User Account Domain used in the vRSLCM Server Connection. If unspecified, @local is assumed.

The Authentication Host of the vRSLCM Server Connection to VMware Identity Manager. If set, authentication requests are redirected here with a Client ID and Secret for authorization.Users in the @local scope do not use this field for authentication.
The User Account Name used in the vRSLCM Server Connection.

properties.property: ID of the resource in the remote system.

Connection associated with the resource.
The vCenter Display Name in vRSLCM
The vCenter Host DNS address
The Locker Reference to the Credential being used for vCenter Host access
The Datacenter associated with the vCenter connection.
The vCenter's latest Data Collection status.
The Credential used for vCenter Authentication.
The vCenter Service User
The vCenter role - Management, Workload, or Both

finder.description: A vRSLCM Request, made by an admin or automated server task.

properties.property: ID of the resource in the remote system.
Connection associated with the resource.
Request Name and Reason
The state of the request as of the last updated time.
The source of the request - can be a regular scheduled task or user generated.
User account that made the request.
The time the request was last updated, as a readable date.
The time the request was last updated, in seconds since the Unix epoch.
The tenant where the Request originated from.

finder.description: A LCM Certificate, either self-signed or signed by a trusted CA.

properties.property: ID of the resource in the remote system.
Connection associated with the resource.
An alias...for the Alias(!) of the Certificate.
The encryption algorithm used in creating the Certificate.
The SHA-1 hash value of the Certificate.
The Alias aka Friendly Name of the Certificate.
The number of bits used to encrypt of the Certificate. Supported values are 2048/4096.
The Certificate Chain associated to the Certificate, base64 encoded.
The date that the Certificate was issued.
The date that the Certificate Expires.
Indicates whether the Certificate is actively in use by a resource in LCM.
The Certificate, base64 encoded.
Certificate Health is whether or not its expired or close to it.
The SHA-256 hash value of the Certificate.
The Subject Alternative Name(s) in the Certificate.
The Issuer of the Certificate.
The Subject Name of the Certificate.

object.description: Management of vRSLCM Connections.

method.description: Deletes a vRSLCM Connection from the Orchestrator inventory by the given ID.

parameters.parameter: vRSLCM Server Connection to delete.

method.description: Retrieves an array of all vRSLCM Connections in the Orchestrator inventory.
Retrieves a vRSLCM Connection in the Orchestrator inventory with the given ID.

parameters.parameter: ID of the vRSLCM Connection to retrieve.

method.description: Updates a vRSLCM Connection in the Orchestrator inventory with the given information.

parameters.parameter: vRSLCM Server ConnectionInfo object to use in update. Construct this object in your script before calling the method.

method.description: Creates a new vRSLCM Connection in the Orchestrator inventory with the given information.Setup your info with this : var info = new vRSLCMConnectionInfo()Then populate the necessary values before calling this method.

parameters.parameter: vRSLCM Server ConnectionInfo object to use in creation. Construct this object in your script before calling the method.

object.description: Represents a vRealize/Aria Automation Product object in LCM.

attributes.attribute: ID of the resource in the remote system.
Connection associated with the resource.
Friendly name of the Product
The Product ID
Version of the Product, usually MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH
Environment ID where the Product is deployed
Specifications used in the deployment of the Product.
The server nodes associated with this Product deployment.

method.description: Request that the system power on the Automation product and its related components. This action will also automatically kick off the deploy script.
Request that the system power off the Automation product and its related components. This action will first SSH into the system to gracefully shutdown the pods before Powering off.

object.description: Represents a Locker Certificate in LCM.

attributes.attribute: ID of the resource in the remote system.
Connection associated with the resource.
An alias...for the Alias(!) of the Certificate.
The encryption algorithm used in creating the Certificate.
The SHA-1 hash value of the Certificate.
The Alias aka Friendly Name of the Certificate.
The number of bits used to encrypt of the Certificate. Supported values are 2048/4096.
The Certificate Chain associated to the Certificate, base64 encoded.
The date that the Certificate was issued.
The date that the Certificate Expires.
Indicates whether the Certificate is actively in use by a resource in LCM.
The Certificate, base64 encoded.
Certificate Health is whether or not its expired or close to it.
The SHA-256 hash value of the Certificate.
The Subject Alternative Name(s) in the Certificate.
The Issuer of the Certificate.
The Subject Name of the Certificate.

object.description: Folder containing Certificates in the Inventory Tab.

attributes.attribute: ID of the resource in the remote system.
Connection associated with the resource.
Name of the folder
ID of the folder

object.description: Container for a SSL Certificate whether it is self-signed by Locker, or used to generate a signing request for external CA.

constructor.description: Empty Default Constructor. Assign the required values in your scripts.
Default Constructor with all required fields.

parameters.parameter: Name/Alias of the Certificate.
Common Name (CN) used on the Certificate.
Organization field used on the Certificate.
Organizational Unit field used on the Certificate.
Country (US, JP, CN) used on the Certificate.
Locality/City field used on the Certificate.
State field used on the Certificate.
Encryption key size used on the Certificate, default is 2048.
List of Subject Alternative Names for the Certificate. These need to be Fully-Qualified Domain Name entries.
Tenant Name

attributes.attribute: State field used on the Certificate.
Country (US, JP, CN) used on the Certificate.
Name/Alias of the Certificate.
Encryption key size used on the Certificate, default is 2048.
Tenant Name
Organization field used on the Certificate.
Organizational Unit field used on the Certificate.
List of Subject Alternative Names for the Certificate. These need to be Fully-Qualified Domain Name entries.
Common Name (CN) used on the Certificate.
Locality/City field used on the Certificate.

method.description: Validates inputs prior to usage.

object.description: Represents a vRSLCM Server Connection.

attributes.attribute: Display Name of the vRSLCM Connection in Orchestrator.
Unique ID of the vRSLCM Connection in Orchestrator.
The Hostname of the vRSLCM Server.
The Required OAuth2.0 Client ID to use in authentication requests to VMware Identity Manager.
The User Account Domain used in the vRSLCM Server Connection. If unspecified, @local is assumed.

The Authentication Host of the vRSLCM Server Connection to VMware Identity Manager. If set, authentication requests are redirected here with a Client ID and Secret for authorization.Users in the @local scope do not use this field for authentication.
The User Account Name used in the vRSLCM Server Connection.

method.description: Use this service to perform operations on Lifecycle Operations scoped objects.
Use this service to perform operations on the LCM Server itself.
Use this service to perform operations on Locker scoped objects.

object.description: Represents the configuration for a vRSLCM Server connection. This object is constructed for Create/Update workflow calls.

constructor.description: Default constructor of the vRSLCM Server Connection Info object. The 'id' field is default populated.

attributes.attribute: The Friendly Name of the vRSLCM Server Connection.
The ID of the vRSLCM Server Connection inside of Orchestrator.
The Hostname of the vRSLCM Server Connection.
The Required OAuth2.0 Client Secret to use in authentication requests to VMware Identity Manager. Encrypted by the platform.
The User Password used in the vRSLCM Server Connection. Encrypted by the platform.
The Required OAuth2.0 Client ID to use in authentication requests to VMware Identity Manager.
The User Domain. If unspecified, @local is assumed.

The Authentication Host of the vRSLCM Server Connection to VMware Identity Manager. If set, authentication requests are redirected here with a Client ID and Secret for authorization.Users in the @local scope do not use this field for authentication.
The User Account used in the vRSLCM Server Connection.

attributes.attribute: ID of the resource in the remote system.
Connection associated with the resource.
Name of the folder
ID of the folder

object.description: Represents a Credential (Password) in LCM.

constructor.description: Empty constructor - set your values in your script before calling for creation.
Constructor containing all required fields for creation.

attributes.attribute: ID of the resource in the remote system.
Connection associated with the resource.
Name/Alias of the credential.
Alias of the Credential
Whether or not the credential is currently in use by LCM-managed resource. If true, the item cannot be deleted.
Date/Time when the object was last updated.
Date/Time when the object was created.
Description of the credential's intended use
User name associated to the credential.
The tenant associated with the credential

object.description: Represents a vRSLCM Environment, containing Products and their Nodes/Servers.

attributes.attribute: Connection associated with the resource.
Name of the Environment
Infrastructure-related properties for the Environment.

The Products that are deployed in the specified environment.

method.description: Trigger Inventory Sync on the Environment. A separate Request object is returned for each Product in the environment.

object.description: Folder containing vRSLCM Environments in the Inventory Tab.

attributes.attribute: ID of the resource in the remote system.
Connection associated with the resource.
Name of the folder
ID of the folder

object.description: Represents a vRSLCM Environment's Infrastructure properties, such as vSphere Cluster, Datastore, Network, and DNS settings.

method.description: Retrieve an infrastructure property value by name.

parameters.parameter: Name of the property to retrieve. The return value could be anything so make sure to add some checks in your script.

attributes.attribute: ID of the resource in the remote system.
Connection associated with the resource.
Friendly name of the Product
The Product ID
Version of the Product, usually MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH
Environment ID where the Product is deployed
Specifications used in the deployment of the Product.
The server nodes associated with this Product deployment.

method.description: Request that the system power on the Identity Manager product and its related components. In a clustered scenario it will also remediate the cluster to ensure everything comes up properly.
Request that the system power off the Identity Manager product and its related components. In a clustered scenario it will also ensure that all components are shut down in the proper order.

object.description: Lifecycle Operations Content

attributes.attribute: ID of the resource in the remote system.
Connection associated with the resource.
Name of the folder
ID of the folder

object.description: Enables access to Lifecycle Operations specific methods for the server connection.

method.description: Request creation of a new vCenter Connection in the Datacenter.

parameters.parameter: The Datacenter to create the vCenter in.
The vCenter object to create.

method.description: Request deleting a vCenter from the Datacenter. If any Environments are associated with it, the Request will fail!

parameters.parameter: The Datacenter containing the vCenter connection to delete.
Name of the vCenter connection to delete.

method.description: Request to perform a data collection on a vCenter.

parameters.parameter: The Datacenter containing the vCenter connection to sync.
Name of the vCenter to sync.

method.description: Request to update a vCenter's information and properties.

parameters.parameter: The Datacenter containing the vCenter connection.
The vCenter to update.
The vCenter object with updated values.

method.description: Creates a new Datacenter with the given name and location.

parameters.parameter: Name of the Datacenter to create.
Location of the Datacenter.

method.description: Retrieves all vCenter connections on the server.
Deletes a Datacenter on the server. Returns a request to monitor for completion.

parameters.parameter: The Datacenter to delete.

method.description: Retrieves an Environment by name or resource ID on this server.

parameters.parameter: Name or ID of the Environment to retrieve.

method.description: Retrieves all Environments for this server.
Retrieves a Request by resource ID on this server.

parameters.parameter: ID of the Request.

method.description: Retrieves a vCenter in a Datacenter by name.

parameters.parameter: The Datacenter to search.
Name of the vCenter.

method.description: Retrieves a Datacenter by name or resource ID on this server.

parameters.parameter: Name or ID of the Datacenter to retrieve.

method.description: Updates an existing Datacenter's name and/or location.

parameters.parameter: The Datacenter to update.
Updated Datacenter name.
Updated Datacenter location.

method.description: Retrieves all Datacenters for this server.
Retrieves all Requests for this server.

object.description: Locker Content

attributes.attribute: ID of the resource in the remote system.
Connection associated with the resource.
Name of the folder
ID of the folder

object.description: Enables access to Locker specific methods for the server connection.

method.description: Creates a Certificate Signing Request based on inputs. Once you have signed the certificate, you can import it using the @importCertificate method.

parameters.parameter: The specifications of the certificate to request.

method.description: Retrieves all Certificates for this server matching the list of aliases.

parameters.parameter: One more values to query for in the list. All matches will be returned.

method.description: Creates a new Locker-signed certificate based on inputs.

parameters.parameter: The specifications of the certificate to request.

method.description: Retrieves all Certificates for this server.
Deletes a Certificate from the server. Must not be referenced by other managed entities.

parameters.parameter: The Certificate object to delete

method.description: Retrieves a Certificate via ID on this server.

parameters.parameter: The ID to search for - also known in LCM as the 'vmid' value

method.description: Imports a signed Certificate chain and private key to the server.

parameters.parameter: Display name of the Certificate being imported.
The full certificate chain as a Base64-encoded string. The order from top to bottom should be the Leaf certificate, Intermediate CA(s), then Root CA
Private key
Passphrase used to decrypt the private key if used

method.description: Retrieves all Credentials for this server.
Deletes an existing Credential. If the credential is in use, this will fail!

parameters.parameter: The credential to delete.

method.description: Retrieves a Credential by name or resource ID on this server.

parameters.parameter: The Name or ID to search in the credential list.

method.description: Creates a new Credential with the specified values.

parameters.parameter: The Alias/Name to assign to the credential.
The Description to assign to the credential.
The Password to specify for this credential.
The associated username for this credential, for example root or sshuser.

method.description: Updates an existing Credential with the specified values.

parameters.parameter: The credential to update.
The Alias/Name to assign to the credential.
The Description to assign to the credential.
The Password to specify for this credential.
The associated username for this credential, for example root or sshuser.

object.description: Represents a node/server used in a particular Product in LCM. Typically, this is a VM.

attributes.attribute: ID of the resource in the remote system.
Connection associated with the resource.
The VM name of the node.
The type of node. Examples are 'vidm-connector' or 'vrava-primary' - this value differs per product.
Specifications of the Node. Use the attached methods to get specific information about the node.

object.description: Specifications of the Product Node. The specifications differ for each Product and Node type, so use the methods attached to find what you're looking for.

method.description: Retrieves a Product Node property by name.

parameters.parameter: Name of the property to get the value of from the Product Node specifications.

method.description: Retrieves a list of Property names for the Product Node. Use this to discover what properties are available for you to key off of, using the @{getNodeProperty} method.

object.description: Specifications used in the deployment of the Product. The specifications differ for each Product, so use the methods attached to find what you're looking for.

method.description: Retrieves a list of Property names for the Product. Use this to discover what properties are available for you to key off of, using the @{getProductProperty} method.
Retrieves a Product property by name.

parameters.parameter: Name of the property to retrieve, such as 'nodeSize'

object.description: Represents a Request in vRSLCM.

attributes.attribute: ID of the resource in the remote system.
Connection associated with the resource.
Request Name and Reason
The state of the request as of the last updated time.
The source of the request - can be a regular scheduled task or user generated.
User account that made the request.
The time the request was last updated, as a readable date.
The time the request was last updated, in seconds since the Unix epoch.
The tenant where the Request originated from.

method.description: Retry a request (if possible)
Get request details for the request
Get request error cause

The Locker Reference to the Credential being used for vCenter Host access
The Datacenter associated with the vCenter connection.
The vCenter's latest Data Collection status.
The Credential used for vCenter Authentication.
The vCenter Service User
The vCenter role - Management, Workload, or Both

method.description: Update the vCenter Connection credential
